reviews.sentence: Great hotel and staff. We recently stayed here with an arrangement with Cincinnati Childrens Hospital. it was very easy to get to the hospital from this location and the rate was wonderful. can not say enough about the service. From check in to our departure everyone was so nice. The room was very nice and we had a great view of the river. Breakfast was very good. The lady who was in charge was helpful and friendly. The selection was good and had many choices. Especially loved the fruit. This turned a stressful few days into a pleasure. Would love to return for other reasons. Thank you.

Great stay. Great rate for those having surgery at Childrens hospital. Location is less than ten minutes to the hospital. The staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean and had no issues. The workout room was small and ac did not work. I would stay there again.

Good. Free breakfast was better than anticipated. Indoor pool was a nice feature for the kids. Free wifi and parking were added bonuses since many places typically charge for these features. Hotel was clean and staff was friendly and helpful. Discounted zoo tickets toIt would have been nice to have more seating available for the free breakfast. It got a little busy and tables chairs were hard to come by. The pool was nice to have but it was pretty chilly considering it was indoors.

Nice and Clean. Hotel was clean. Front desk provided good service. Breakfast was pretty decent. There was quite a variety to choose from. Hotel is near many good places to eat. Would stay here again. Décor is a little outdated but clean.

night before bengals fotbal game. everything went smoothly the check in to the front desk giving us some info. the rooms were great and clean. my grandson and me was there for the football game the next day so it was all we needed plus the inside pool work out great for him. there are some people partying that night but nothing bad. probably because of the game the next day. the breakfast was great to. i would stay here again.

Cheper alternative for seeing Cincinati. We stayed here while visiting Cincinnati for a long weekend. It is located riverfront right across from downtown. Cheaper rates free parking and free breakfast were all benefits of choosing this motel. The rooms are quiet comfortable and clean. The motel staff is very friendly. They have a great morning breakfast and offer coffee tea and a selection of fresh fruit 247. While there are two liquor stores in the parking lot the area felt safe. There is a trolley a short walk from the motel that runs a circuit thru Cincinnati and Covington for one dollar a ride. It stops a major sights shopping and restaurant areas. Uber to downtown is 4. There a couple fast food type restaurants a couple blocks away. CVG airport is an easy 15 minute drive.

Southern hospitality indeed. Our family of seven stayed in connecting rooms. The accommodations were excellent. Beds are nice and comfortable clean rooms and an excellent breakfast that is included in the price. The front desk was so helpful and welcomed us with open arms. Hospitality is the best I have seen even in the very costly hotels. Front desk even gave us a deck of cards for the kids. The continental breakfast offers a variety of food bagels and cream cheese sweet rolls eggs and sausage or bacon fresh fruit piping hot waffles and coffee is brewing all day. This was our fifth stay at the Hampton Cincinnati Riverfront and we will be back. Highly recommend.
Great stay for 2 nights. We stayed in coordination with our childrens hospital visit. So nice and courteous.

Great hotel. Nice hotel. Room was nice and clean. Had there breakfast next morning. Good choices in food. Front desk was extremely nice. Good location to the bridge to cross into Cincinnati. We were on our way to the childrens hospital. Also the pool is great especially since we had a two year old.

Excellent. My son and I stayed at the Hampton by Hilton because he was an outpatient at the Cincinnati Childrens Hospital. The hotel gave us a discount. Excellent facilities and location. Not only were we close to the hospital but we were also close to the many tourists destinations we visited.

Spur of the moment trip. I slept great. Room was comfortablewould stay again. It was a spur of the moment decision to bring the family downwe had a nice weekend. Kids loved the pool. And lots to do all near by. Oh yes very surprised by the large breakfast you offer with the room. Never had that before. Excelant. Biscuits and gravey wow one of several itemscould not stay longer.

Excellent Getaway. In the area for a wedding reception and decided to book a room for both a romantic night out of the house away from the kids and to not risk driving impaired. Aside from a slow Wi Fi connection which was not important to us for this visit the hotel was perfect for our needs. Breakfast was good.

Love Hampton Inns just not this one. While it is ideally located to 75 it is not in the best of areas and looks quite rundown. Beds were not that comfortable and I found 3 long blonde hairs 2 inside the bed and one on a towel. I am sure it was the cleaning person and while I am sure the room was clean those hairs creeped me out. Breakfast was very decent and well maintained. Staff was very friendly and they gave our group a shuttle to and from the wedding reception. Most everyone else was satisfied with their accommodations so perhaps I am being picky but Hampton Inns are normally very well maintained so I was surprised by the appearance of this one. Definitely needs a good refresh. I requested a King and we got 2 Queens however we checked in early and perhaps that was all that was available.

Friendly staff otherwise just OK. The disappointment with this Hampton Inn began when we realized that Riverfront is in the name but the river in question is not even visible amidst the generally industrial feeling neighborhood and the highway interchanges. The main attraction of the location is Mainstrase a faux German village about 5 blocks away walkable but the streets are not pedestrian friendly. We ended up going into downtown Cincinnati for dinner which was easy to do. Lacking a good location the hotel qualifies for an average rating because the look and feel of the room is dated and showing signs of at best deferred attention. Dirty walls and stains on the carpet were the biggest symptoms. Free parking may make this location advantageous for some given that access to downtown is easy although for traffic concerns it is good to pay attention to sports events happening at the stadium just across the river.

Bad Service. We booked this hotel over the Labor Day weekend. Yes it was a holiday weekend and therefore the hotel should have been better prepared for that than they were. Check in time is 30 pm when we arrived were told there were no rooms available and we had have to wait and then they could not even give an approximate wait time before a room would be cleaned and ready. Apparently they were sold out the night before no one checked out on Sunday until noon. the check out time and they had every room in the hotel to ready for Sundays check in and this was not accomplished before 3 pm. Therefore many guests were told they had to wait. Check in is supposed to be at 3 pm we did get a room until 6 pm. We were not compensated in price for their inability to honor check in times which I feel was the least they could do for the inconvenience. they did not even try to call people to let them know. I found this all completely unacceptable. Almost 200 for the room and this is how you get treated.

Great Hotel and Staff. Friendly Staff Management cozy clean great breakfast buffet and indoor pool. My room was perfect very cozy clean and the bed and water pressure in the shower was excellent. I was in town on business to meet with a Sr VP from Corporex. We met in the spacious lobby and not only is the staff and management great at this hotel the guest are too. I will always stay at this property when doing business in Cincinnati. I would recommend the Hotel to everyone I know. The managers name is Beth walked up and very politely introduced herself and asked how my stay was going and if there was anything they could do to improve my stay. I told her she was a great manager and not only does it show the moment you meet her but you can also see it in her entire staff. Excellent evening cookies at the front desk also. Great Hotel Great StafEric D.

Not great. The room was clean but the bathroom lighting was awful and I asked to get a bulb that was out replaced over the sink but it did not happen. The bed pillows where terrible. The breakfast was crowded and mediocre. The location was central to what we needed but surrounding area was questionable.

I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Stayed here awaiting Ronald McDonald house staff was great maids were friendly and helpful. Rates were good w CMC discount. The breakfast was delicious and if you befriend the cooks even get requests. Indoor pool was nice but could be a little warmer. can not say enough about how nice the maids and the rest of the staff were.

Awesome room and friendly service. Stayed here for a business conference. 5 adults in a suite and we had more than enough room. The room was very spacious and clean. Breakfast was served daily but there was not a ton to choose from. What they had was good. I would def stay here again with no hesitation.

Newer Clean and Good Breakfast. This hotel seems fairly new and was very clean. Room was nice and spacious but the bed was somewhat hard. Breakfast was surprisingly good. Nice area to sit and eat. Breakfast consisted of your choice of eggs or eggs and cheese and sausage. Also the usual waffle muffins and cereals. The eggs and sausage was very good. Would definitely stay here again.

You should start a spreadsheet of local restaurants that you recommend. When I asked where was good to eat the girl at the counter acted like she had never been asked that before. I imagine that is a pretty common question.

Across the River. Good access to travel over to Cincinnati you can get on and off the freeway. Good access to all areas of Cincinnati it was just over the bridge. it is probably better for those that have a car. We were able to get in and out of the downtown area easily but we also had a GPS. When you turn into the hotel it is a very quick turn. We only had a view of the top of buildings but the rooms were very nice. We did the Underground Rail Road Museum which was fantastic it also talked about how involved women were at that time. The breakfast was the standard Best Western Comfort Inns breakfast waffle some rolls scrambled eggs etc. Over all for the money it was a good deal as I had checked hotels in Cincinnati they were much more expensive.
rooms clean. Liquor store next door. Modern feel interiors.

Excellent. Very clean and comfortable. Had all of the amenities needed. The location is not the best as far as the surrounding scenery. The buildings close by were a little rundown. But it was located close to a lot of good restaurants and attractions.

Close to downtown Cinci without the downtown price. I had a business meeting in downtown Cincinnati early in the morning so I looked for a hotel close to the location. Many hotels were close but charged 30 to park. This Best Western was just as close while not charging for parking and the cost was much less expensive. The room was very neat and bed was very comfortable. There were enough outlets on the desk without having to search for one. I asked for a quiet room and was given one at the end of the hall so I heard no noise and no one walking around at night. The breakfast has many options and the hot food was hot and cold food was cold. I would definitely stay here again when I have business in the area.

Check in took long even though we paid for all the rooms beforehand. There are a lot of little perks and details that were really cute. Breakfast was sufficient. The only thing is that the neighborhood might not be the best as someone stole gas from our car during our stay. Location is convenient to downtown Cincinnati and Newport Aquarium. Overall it was a great place for the price and location.

Visit was a 3 night one for a 2 day woodworking course. Very comfortable room and bed. Breakfast area was very comfortable and food was good. Very convenient to Interstate 75 for easy access coming and leaving. Short walk to Covington restaurants on Main Street and 7 minute drive to my course location. No complaints.

Trip to northern Kentucky. Great time. Heavy traffic but nice. relaxing time. We were on 6th floor and could look out at the Ohio River and the Cincinnati skyline until next morning. THICK fog came in during the night. Great walking path it appeared but husband was ill so did not go for a walk.

The rooms desperately need sound barriers. We were surrounded by kids on each side and across the hall and could hear EVERYTHING. The kids were constantly screaming crying laughing hitting the walls etc. we could even hear them getting a bath and the water sloshing and splashing. What was aggravating is the parents never stopped the hitting the walls or screaming and yelling. Thankfully the everything quieted down around 11 pm but started back up before 070 so no sleeping in. The staff however was VERY nice and courteous. We could not be moved because the entire hotel was sold out.
